title: Music Tools?
content:
What kind of tools do you guys use to make music? Be it MIDI or MP3. Because I would like to get into making music for my keen and non-keen related projects.

Many thanks

title: Re: Music Tools?
content:
I've tested out some programs, and found a few nice ones. Although, they aren't free.

[url=http://www.midimaestro.com/]MIDI Maestro[/url] - Probably the nicest MIDI editing program I've ever seen. You can edit more than one track at once, as well as view the MIDI in a staff mode. $100

[url=http://www.fruityloops.com/]FL Studio[/url] - This one is good for making MP3's, and can also make MIDI's, but not as well as other programs. I should probably buy it one day... I haven't been able to save anything that I've worked on. But, if you work fast, you can export to an MP3, and won't ever have to save. $50-$200.

But, if you're looking for free software, I can't help you. I've been looking for a freeware music editing program for far too long...-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Music Tools?
content:
I highly recommend MilkyTracker if you want to try the MOD path (and of course that can lead to MP3 if necessary).

I've not much experience with other stuff. It'd be interesting to hear what others use for MIDI though.

title: Re: Music Tools?
content:
